example.code:
PS C:\> $options = @( @{Key="domain-name";Values=@("abc.local")}, @{Key="domain-name-servers";Values=@("10.0.0.101","10.0.0.102")}) PS C:\> New-EC2DhcpOption -DhcpConfiguration $options
DhcpConfigurations DhcpOptionsId Tags ------------------ ------------- ---- {domain-name, domain-name-servers} dopt-1a2b3c4d {}
example.description: This example creates the specified set of DHCP options. The syntax used by this example requires PowerShell version 3 or later.

example.code:
PS C:\> $option1 = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.DhcpConfiguration PS C:\> $option1.Key = "domain-name" PS C:\> $option1.Values = "abc.local"
PS C:\> $option2 = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.DhcpConfiguration PS C:\> $option2.Key = "domain-name-servers" PS C:\> $option2.Values = @("10.0.0.101","10.0.0.102")
PS C:\> New-EC2DhcpOption -DhcpConfiguration @($option1, $option2)
DhcpConfigurations DhcpOptionsId Tags ------------------ ------------- ---- {domain-name, domain-name-servers} dopt-2a3b4c5d {}
example.description: With PowerShell version 2, you must use New-Object to create each DHCP option.
